api_arguments.userId: The user's email address. The special value 'me' can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

functionality: Gets the current user's Gmail profile.
example_code:
from googleapiclient.discovery import build 
 from oauth2client import file, client, tools 
 store = file.Storage('token.json') 
 creds = store.get() 
 service = build('gmail', 'v1', credentials=creds) 
 results = service.users().getProfile(userId='me').execute()

meta_data.description: The Users.getProfile method of Gmail API allows for retrieving basic profile information of a user, such as the email address and account ID.

api_arguments.userId: The user's email address. The special value 'me' can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

functionality: User stops receiving push notifications for the given user mailbox.
example_code:
from googleapiclient.discovery import build 
 from oauth2client import file, client, tools 
 store = file.Storage('token.json') 
 creds = store.get() 
 service = build('gmail', 'v1', credentials=creds) 
 results = service.users().getProfile(userId='me').execute()

meta_data.description: The Users.stop method stops any push notifications (set up via Gmail API's watch method) for the authenticated user's Gmail account.

api_arguments.userId: The user's email address. The special value 'me' can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

body.ids: A list of message IDs to delete. These should be the unique IDs of the messages.

functionality: Deletes many messages by message ID. Provides no guarantees that messages were not already deleted or even existed at all.

body.removeLabelIds: List of label IDs to remove from the messages.

functionality: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified message. This operation cannot be undone.

api_arguments.format: The format to return the message in. Options include 'minimal', 'full', 'raw', and 'metadata'.

functionality: Gets the specified message.

api_arguments.userId: The user's email address. The special value 'me' can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
api_arguments.body: The raw RFC822 formatted message to import.
api_arguments.internalDateSource: Source of the internal date of the message. Options include 'date_received' and 'date_header'.
api_arguments.deleted: Boolean indicating if the message should be immediately marked as permanently deleted.
api_arguments.processForCalendar: Boolean indicating if the message should be processed for calendar invites.
api_arguments.neverMarkedAsSpam: Boolean indicating if the message should never be marked as spam.

functionality: Imports a message into only this user's mailbox, with standard email delivery scanning and classification similar to receiving via SMTP.

api_arguments.userId: The user's email address. The special value 'me' can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
api_arguments.body: The raw RFC822 formatted message to insert.
api_arguments.internalDateSource: Source of the internal date of the message. Options include 'date_received' and 'date_header'.
api_arguments.deleted: Boolean indicating if the message should be immediately marked as permanently deleted.

functionality: Directly inserts a message into only this user's mailbox similar to IMAP APPEND, bypassing most scanning and classification. Does not send a message.

api_arguments.userId: The user's email address. The special value 'me' can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
api_arguments.labelIds: List of labels to filter by. Optional.
api_arguments.q: Query string to filter messages. Optional.
api_arguments.pageToken: Token for the page of results to retrieve. Optional.
api_arguments.maxResults: Maximum number of results to return. Optional.

body.enabled: Boolean indicating whether auto-forwarding is enabled or disabled.
body.emailAddress: The email address to which messages are forwarded.
body.disposition: The disposition of the messages which are auto-forwarded. Options are 'leaveInInbox', 'archive', 'trash', 'markRead', etc.

functionality: Updates the auto-forwarding setting for the specified account. A verified forwarding address must be specified when auto-forwarding is enabled.

body.enabled: Boolean indicating whether IMAP is enabled or disabled.
body.autoExpunge: Boolean indicating whether to immediately expunge messages when they are marked as deleted in IMAP.
body.expungeBehavior: Indicates the behavior of expunge. Options are 'archive', 'trash', or 'deleteForever'.
body.maxFolderSize: An integer indicating the maximum size of an IMAP folder.

functionality: Updates IMAP settings.

body.languageCode: The language code (as per ISO 639-1) for the new language setting.

functionality: Updates POP settings.

body.enableAutoReply: Boolean indicating whether the auto-responder is enabled.

body.restrictToContacts: Boolean indicating if the response is sent only to people in the user's contacts.
body.restrictToDomain: Boolean indicating if the response is sent only to people in the user's domain.
body.startTime: The start time for the auto-reply in milliseconds since epoch.
body.endTime: The end time for the auto-reply in milliseconds since epoch.

body.isPrimary: Whether this alias should be set as the primary send-as alias.
body.isDefault: Whether this alias should be used as the default send-as alias.
body.treatAsAlias: Whether to treat this alias as an alias for external forwarding.
body.smtpMsa: SMTP configuration for the alias (host, port, username, password).

functionality: Patch the specified send-as alias.

api_call: service.users().settings().sendAs().update(userId='user_id', sendAsEmail='alias@example.com', body={'displayName': 'Updated Alias Name', 'replyToAddress': 'updated_reply@example.com', 'isPrimary': true, 'isDefault': true, 'treatAsAlias': false, 'smtpMsa': {'host': 'smtp.example.com', 'port': 587, 'username': 'smtp_user', 'password': 'smtp_password'}}).execute()

body.defaultKeyId: The ID of the S/MIME key to use as the default.
body.issuerCn: The S/MIME certificate issuer's common name.
body.isDefault: Whether this SmimeInfo is the default one for this user's send-as address.
body.expiration: When the certificate expires (in milliseconds since epoch).
body.encryptedKeyPassword: Encrypted key password, when the key is encrypted.

key.pem: PEM formatted X509 concatenated certificate string (standard base64 encoding).
key.pkcs12: PKCS#12 format containing a single private/public key pair and certificate chain (base64-encoded).

functionality: Insert (upload) the given S/MIME config for the specified send-as alias. Note that pkcs12 format is required for the key.

api_name: yfinance - Yahoo Finance Mass Download of Market Data API

api_arguments.tickers: A list of stock tickers to download data for (separated by space)
api_arguments.group_by: Optional parameter to group data by 'ticker' (default) or 'column' (group data by column names)

functionality: Mass download historical market data for multiple stocks from Yahoo Finance
example_code:
import yfinance as yf 

tickers = 'SPY AAPL' 
start_date = '2017-01-01' 
end_date = '2017-04-30' 
data = yf.download(tickers, start=start_date, end=end_date, group_by='ticker')

meta_data.description: yfinance is a Python library that allows you to download historical market data from Yahoo Finance in a reliable and Pythonic way. You can use it to mass download data for multiple stock tickers at once, specifying a start and end date. By default, data is grouped by ticker, but you can also choose to group it by column names.

api_name: yfinance - Yahoo Finance Get History Metadata API

api_arguments.ticker: Stock ticker to download data for

functionality: Get historical meta data from Yahoo Finance
example_code:
import yfinance as yf 

msft = yf.Ticker('MSFT') 

# get historical market data 
hist = msft.history(period='1mo') 
print(msft.history_metadata)

meta_data.description: yfinance is a Python library that allows you to download historical market data from Yahoo Finance in a reliable and Pythonic way. It provides access to historical data with up to 1-minute granularity.

api_name: yfinance - Yahoo Finance Dividends Data API

api_arguments.ticker: Stock ticker to download data for

functionality: Get historical meta data from Yahoo Finance
example_code:
import yfinance as yf 

msft = yf.Ticker('MSFT') 

print(msft.dividends)

meta_data.description: yfinance is a Python library that allows you to download historical market data from Yahoo Finance in a reliable and Pythonic way. It provides access to historical data with up to 1-minute granularity.

meta_data.description: yfinance is a Python library that allows you to download historical market data from Yahoo Finance in a reliable and Pythonic way. It provides access to historical data with up to 1-minute granularity.
